org.jbox2d.dynamics

Class Fixture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jbox2d.dynamics.Fixture

  • public class Fixture
extends Object
    A fixture is used to attach a shape to a body for collision detection. A fixture inherits its transform from its parent. Fixtures hold additional non-geometric data such as friction, collision filters, etc. Fixtures are created via Body::CreateFixture. Note: you cannot reuse fixtures.
    Author:
    daniel

      • m_proxies

        public FixtureProxy[] m_proxies

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public ShapeType getType()
        Get the type of the child shape. You can use this to down cast to the concrete shape.
        Returns:
        the shape type

      • getShape

        public Shape getShape()
        Get the child shape. You can modify the child shape, however you should not change the number of vertices because this will crash some collision caching mechanisms.
        Returns:
        child shape

      • isSensor

        public boolean isSensor()
        Is this fixture a sensor (non-solid)?
        Returns:
        true if the shape is a sensor.

      • setSensor

        public void setSensor(boolean sensor)
        Set if this fixture is a sensor.
        Parameters:
        sensor - sensor flag

      • setFilterData

        public void setFilterData(Filter filter)
        Set the contact filtering data. This is an expensive operation and should not be called frequently. This will not update contacts until the next time step when either parent body is awake. This automatically calls refilter.
        Parameters:
        filter - filter

      • getFilterData

        public Filter getFilterData()
        Returns:
        the contact filtering data

      • getProxyCount

        public int getProxyCount()

      • getProxies

        public FixtureProxy[] getProxies()

      • refilter

        public void refilter()
        Call this if you want to establish collision that was previously disabled by ContactFilter::ShouldCollide.

      • getBody

        public Body getBody()
        Get the parent body of this fixture.
        Returns:
        the parent body

      • setDensity

        public void setDensity(float density)

      • getDensity

        public float getDensity()
        Returns:
        density

      • getUserData

        public Object getUserData()
        Get the user data that was assigned in the fixture definition. Use this to store your application specific data.
        Returns:
        user data

      • setUserData

        public void setUserData(Object data)
        Set the user data. Use this to store your application specific data.
        Parameters:
        data - user data

      • containsPoint

        public boolean containsPoint(Vec2 p)
        Test a point for containment in this fixture. This only works for convex shapes.
        Parameters:
        p - a point in world coordinates

      • raycast

        public boolean raycast(RayCastOutput output,
                       RayCastInput input,
                       int childIndex)
        Cast a ray against this shape.
        Parameters:
        output - the ray-cast results
        input - the ray-cast input parameters

      • getMassData

        public void getMassData(MassData massData)
        Get the mass data for this fixture. The mass data is based on the density and the shape. The rotational inertia is about the shape's origin.

      • getFriction

        public float getFriction()
        Returns:
        the coefficient of friction

      • setFriction

        public void setFriction(float friction)
        Set the coefficient of friction. This will NOT change the friction of existing contacts.
        Parameters:
        friction - friction

      • getRestitution

        public float getRestitution()
        Returns:
        the coefficient of restitution

      • setRestitution

        public void setRestitution(float restitution)
        Set the coefficient of restitution. This will NOT change the restitution of existing contacts.
        Parameters:
        restitution - restitution

      • getAABB

        public AABB getAABB(int childIndex)
        Get the fixture's AABB. This AABB may be enlarge and/or stale. If you need a more accurate AABB, compute it using the shape and the body transform.
        Returns:
        AABB

      • computeDistance

        public float computeDistance(Vec2 p,
                             int childIndex,
                             Vec2 normalOut)
        Compute the distance from this fixture.
        Parameters:
        p - a point in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        distance

        public void createProxies(BroadPhase broadPhase,
                          Transform xf)
